data.title: Office of the Provost
data.text:
UAF Adjunct Award

2022-23/2023-24 AWARD INFORMATION

Open Call for Nominations: 2022-23/2023-24

Deadline: May 11, 2024

2022-23/2023-24 PRESIDENT'S ADJUNCT AWARD NOMINATION SUBMISSION FORM

Nomination documents combined in (1) ONE PDF file is uploaded at the form.

This award is to recognize adjunct faculty members who have demonstrated excellence in teaching. The University, at its sole discretion, may confer upon a bargaining unit member the title of University of Alaska Presidentâ€™s Adjunct Faculty. Upon conferral of the title, the bargaining unit member will receive a lump-sum of $1,500.

Eligibility: All Adjunct faculty members are eligible as long as they have taught a minimum of one (1) credit in the semester they will receive the award. Adjunct faculty members who have received the award within the previous three (3) years are ineligible. Each of the three main campuses may nominate up to two (2) semi-finalists (which would include the outlying remote campuses in their area). Any nominated candidate who is not selected shall remain nominated for the subsequent semester as long as they are teaching in that subsequent semester. Up to three awards each semester may be awarded.

Nominations: An adjunct faculty member may be nominated by any full or part-time faculty member, another adjunct faculty member, staff member, or member of the student body. Nominations should include a letter of nomination and may include the following:

A cover letter from the Department Chair (if the Chair is not nominating)

Additional letters of support from faculty members and/or students

Supporting materials which may include a personal statement on teaching, sample course syllabi, and possible student evaluation comments.

Please contact the Provost's Office at 907-474-7096 or uaf-provost-awards@alaska.edu for more information.
